intro: Nageia formosensis, commonly known as the Formosan nageia, is a rare evergreen conifer native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structure. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Its botanical features include a straight trunk and a conical crown, making it a distinctive species in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
